message: Graphic Designer, there is Creative Commons to protect your graphics; Software Developer, you just take the code and use it from stackoverflow!! Why there is protection for graphic designer but none for software developers code? They are both contents aren't they! Creative Commons should be named Graphics Commons GC.

data.message: Imagine you get a piece of code somewhere and the author tells you put my name in your program!!

The code provided in StackOverflow answers (and the like) is not copy protected, and is specifically meant to be used by others.

The same goes for any code that is available online, it always has a copyright note attached either explicitly or implicitly.
Yeah, im saying there is copyright for style and graphics but not for codes.

There are copyrights for code. The most famous is GPL for example. Most people ignore that since they can embed the code within theirs and no one will notice, but it does not mean that it is non existent.

GPL is free software license. It has nothing to do with "you can use my code only if you put my name in your program/site" as some graphic designers do with creative commons. Someone can draw an icon, and demand you to put his/her name in your site! if you don't then they can sue you if they want as their graphic is in your site/program.
IIRC, you cannot use GPL code without making your own code GPL as well as include the original copyright notice, which contains info about the original code author.
